education.field_of_study: Human Geography and International Development Studies

profile_positions.description: Coordination of the WaterWorX programme, a partnership between all ten Dutch drinking water utilities and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs with the goal to increase sustainable access to safe drinking water with 10 million people in 2030. Main responsibilities include setting up the second phase (2022-2026) of the programme, the WaterWorX coordination team, partnership management, annual planning and reporting.
profile_positions.title: Programme Coordinator WaterWorX

profile_positions.description: Coordination of the WaterWorX programme, a partnership between all ten Dutch drinking water utilities and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs with the goal to increase sustainable access to safe drinking water with 10 million people in 2030. Main responsibilities include knowledge management, partnership management, activities related to long term resilient water supply planning and improving the enabling environment, annual planning and reporting, the End Term Review and the development of the programme proposal for the second phase of the WaterWorX programme (2022-2026).
profile_positions.title: Deputy Programme Coordinator WaterWorX

profile_positions.description:
As Resident Project Officer Asia, I’ve implemented the WaterWorX project "Towards Climate Resilient Water Supply in the Southwestern Mekong Delta" and I’m engaged with portfolio management of the projects in the region Asia. I'm especially involved with the WaterWorX projects in Semarang (Indonesia), Mandalay (Myanmar) and Central Visayas (the Philippines) and the FWD project in Cagayan d'Oro (the Philippines).  The main topics I work on are resilient long term water supply planning, organizational development, enabling environment, investments, network extension projects in low income areas and Monitoring & Evaluation.

Towards Climate Resilient Water Supply in the Southwestern Mekong Delta
The project aims to support the water companies in the Mekong Delta in delivering sustainable and resilient water supply services in the context of climate change. Phase 1 of the project runs from 2018-2021 and focuses on developing climate resilient investment planning, organisational improvement of the utilities, and network extensions. To overcome challenges such as saline intrusion and soil subsidence, a regional approach for upgrading, expansion and modification of supply schemes is believed to be necessary. The project is a collaboration between SOCTRANGWACO (Soc Trang), CANTHOWASSCO (Can Tho), CANTHO2WASUCO (Can Tho), HAWASUCO (Hau Giang), CTU-Dragon Institute, VEI and the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs. Within the project, the MoFA aims to strengthen the enabling environment of laws & regulations, financing and policies in which water companies are encouraged to function properly and enhance their performance.
profile_positions.title: Resident Project Officer Asia / Water Supply Expert

profile_positions.description: For seven months, I’ve worked as interim Resident Project Manager of the WaterWorX project "Towards Climate Resilient Water Supply in the Southwestern Mekong Delta". My responsibilities include leading a team of six Vietnamese staff and 14 Dutch Short Term Experts, managing the daily operations of the project, managing the financials, planning and reporting, stakeholder relations.
profile_positions.title: Interim Resident Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
WaterWorX is a flagship program that brings together all 10 Dutch water utilities and more than 35 water operators in developing countries to provide 10 million people with sustainable access to clean drinking water through Water Operator Partnerships (WOPs). Supported by the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs (DGIS), this programme enables Dutch and local water experts to collaborate in WOP projects, across Asia, Africa and Latin America, over the coming 14 years.
WaterWorX aims to increase sustainable access to drinking water to 10 million people, by:
1. Strengthening the financial, technical and social sustainability of the local partner water companies in order to make sustainable drinking water available to millions of people in developing and transition countries.
2. Strengthening the enabling environment of laws & regulations, financing and policies in which water companies are encouraged to function properly and enhance their performance.
3. Increasing access to water infrastructure investment finance, by developing investment proposals and engaging with domestic and international fi nancing organisations and banks.

At VEI, the leading partner of the WaterWorX programme, I worked on setting up and coordinating the programme. Highlights included successfully finalising the inception phase, the annual plans for 2018 and 2019, setting up a Monitoring and Evaluation framework and the Amsterdam International Water Week, where all involved WaterWorX partners came together celebrating the kick-off of 25 Water Operator Partnerships.
profile_positions.title: Program Officer WaterWorX

profile_positions.description: Providing capacity building trainings to youthled partner organizations in Asia, Latin-America and Africa and advocating for progressive SRHR language and meaningful youth participation in UN outcome documents. Highlights included representing CHOICE at the United Nations Sustainable Development Summit 2015, facilitating a Theory of Change workshop in Kenya and facilitating a Leadership Development workshop in Indonesia.
profile_positions.title: Youth Advocate
